result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacey L. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.
  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars or liquor stores, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed. Random drug screenings to be conducted by the supervising agent.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

miscConds.notes: Same conditions as listed for Count 3 with the exception of the Jail Time.
Same repayment conditions as noted for Count 3

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 10:23 AM Defendant Stacey L. Anderson in court, in custody.  Attorney Paul Edward Zilles in court for Stacey L. Anderson.  Attorney Tucker Tollefson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Counts 3 & 4 - Guilty. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Counts 1 & 2 - DRI. Sentencing argument by Atty Tollefson. Sentencing argument by Atty Zilles. Statement by the DE. Court orders: S/W - 6 years probation. Conditions: 12 months Waushara County Jail, 208 days CFTS. AODA and follow through. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars or liquor stores, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Random drug screenings to be conducted by the supervising agent. Costs w/ 6 months to pay or PP. DNA Sample and Surcharge. Appeal rights given.
